title: Laser Ultrasonic Imaging via the Time Domain Linear Sampling Method
authors:
Jian Song and Fatemeh Pourahmadian and Todd W. Murray and
  Venkatalakshmi V. Narumanchi
abstract:
This study investigates the imaging ability of the time-domain linear
sampling method (TLSM) when applied to laser ultrasonic (LU) tomography of
subsurface defects from limited-aperture measurements. In this vein, the TLSM
indicator and it spectral counterpart known as the multifrequency LSM are
formulated within the context of LU testing. The affiliated imaging functionals
are then computed using synthetic and experimental data germane to LU
inspection of aluminum alloy specimens with manufactured defects.
Hyperparameters of inversion are computationally analyzed. We demonstrate using
synthetic data that the TLSM indicator has the unique ability to recover weak
(or hard-to-reach) scatterers and has the potential to generate higher quality
images compared to LSM. Provided high-SNR measurements, this advantage may be
preserved in reconstructions from LU test data.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Signal Processing
